title: Establishing a White House Office for Special Peace Missions
summary: The document titled "Executive Order 14311 of June 30, 2025" establishes the White House Office for Special Peace Missions, aimed at ending global conflicts. The office will be led by a Special Envoy for Peace Missions, appointed by the President. This envoy will collaborate with the Department of State, the Department of Defense, and other relevant agencies to advance peace efforts. The order clarifies that it does not alter existing authority of executive departments or create enforceable rights against the U.S. government. The establishment of this office reflects a commitment to international peace initiatives and the coordination of federal resources to address ongoing conflicts.
